title: County executive wants to dump Rams name from street
text:
CLAYTON, Mo. (AP) - The NFL’s Rams are long gone from St. Louis, and a top elected official wants to get rid of a street name that honors the team.

St. Louis County Executive Sam Page says he will ask the County Council on Friday to pass legislation changing the name of the street that runs adjacent to the team’s former practice facility. The street was dubbed Rams way in 1996. Page, a Democrat, wants to change it to Athletic Way.

Rams owner Stan Kroenke moved his team to Los Angeles in 2016. The Rams played at the domed stadium in downtown St. Louis during their time in Missouri, but practiced and had offices at the facility in west St. Louis County owned by the St. Louis Regional Convention and Sports Complex Authority.

description: The NFL's Rams are long gone from St. Louis, and a top elected official wants to get rid of a street name that honors the team.
